page.title: 09A school day
page.content: Most of us arrive by taxi - only five live in Foxearth. At 9.0 we have Assembly; I like the hymns in the BBC book best. We do the 'hard' work most of the morning starting with Diary; I like to do a picture with mine. We go on to Maths and English. Most days there is a TV programme - more work and it's hard to keep up to date. If all goes well we can have a short go on the computer between subjects. Mrs Flinn sells biscuits and nuts at break and she looks after us at dinnertime. In the summer we all have a swim at 1pm. In the afternoons we do art, or needlework or pottery with Mrs Finch and Mrs Flinn helps. If it's fine Mr Finch takes netball and rounders. I thought the ball was hard at first but it's really good. We haven't enough for a school team. We go home at 3.30. I usually enjoy it very much.
